title: A century-old Argentine tradition
summary: For nearly a century, fileteado has been making the streets of the Argentine capital ever more vibrant and is now a trademark just as important as tango.

title: Japan’s last female pearl-divers
summary: The tradition of Japanese freediving has been passed down through generations of women since the 8th Century. Now, it is at risk of disappearing.

title: From 'hell' to beacon of sustainability
summary: For three years in a row, Sweden's second-largest city has been declared the world's most sustainable destination.

title: Japan's 'naked' festival of the gods
summary: For more than 1,000 years, people in Chiba have honoured Japan's eight-million gods by carrying them out to sea as part of a Hadaka Matsuri ("naked festival").

title: A mysterious ode to the Knights Templar
summary: At the heart of Sintra's Quinta da Regaleira, a breath-taking initiation well celebrates Portugal's unique historical connection to the mysterious Knights Templar.

title: The US’ little-known subculture
summary: “Hons” have become one of Baltimore’s most prominent mascots – but the subculture's roots can be traced to humble beginnings.

title: What makes this country so happy?
summary: Despite being prone to natural disasters, this Pacific archipelago's unique combination of sustainability and tradition makes it one of the happiest places in the world.

title: The artefacts hidden from the Taliban
summary: After thousands of priceless artefacts were smashed by Taliban forces, the country’s National Museum is piecing the fragments back together and hopes to unveil them this year.
